# Arpeggio: Dominant 7#5 in F (Shape: G)

An arpeggio is the sounding of the notes of a chord in sequence, rather than simultaneously. The dominant 7#5 arpeggio in F with a shape of G consists of the notes G (root), B, D#, and F. This arpeggio contains the intervals of a major third (G to B), an augmented fifth (G to D#), and a minor seventh (G to F).

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This arpeggio is often used in jazz, fusion, and other complex and modern genres. The dominant 7#5 flavor adds a sense of tension and dissonance to the music due to the augmented fifth, which creates a unique and edgy sound compared to traditional dominant 7 arpeggios.

## Songs
1. Song 1: *Impressions* by John Coltrane - This jazz standard features the dominant 7#5 arpeggio prominently in its improvisational sections.
   
2. Song 2: *Elegant Gypsy Suite* by Al Di Meola - This fusion piece showcases the arpeggio in various fast-paced and intricate passages.
   
3. Song 3: *Tension and Release* by Snarky Puppy - This modern jazz composition incorporates the dominant 7#5 arpeggio to create tension-filled moments that resolve dynamically.

This information will help music students understand and explore the application of the dominant 7#5 arpeggio in their playing and composition.
